summary: very furry and fluffy with big animal-like eyes to keep the design faithful to the original but still have a realistic presence....

Detective Pikachu vs. Sonic 2019

very furry and fluffy with big animal-like eyes to keep the design faithful to the original but still have a realistic presence. not some peoples cup of tea, but an objectively well-handled design.

the monster that lives in my closet and tries to kill me when i sleep

summary: My Turn off to Detective Pikachu
title: My Turn off to Detective Pikachu
body:
I already knew from announcement that I was gonna see this movie.This could go from good, to bad, to so bad it’s good. Kinda like the Power rangers 2016 film, which I got exactly what i expected and enjoyed.

Then the trailer dropped. And while it didn’t kill my interest in the film per se, I did find something I didn’t quite care for in it.

Ryan Reynolds as Pikachu.

Don’t get me wrong, I like the guy and I think he’s hilarious. But his voice coming out of another character’s mouth is just…distracting. He’s playing it the same way he’s played his recent roles. Even the writing for his character comes across as just another Ryan Reynolds character, and not just a character (the “so lonlely” and Mr. Mime scenes). He’s not even adjusting his voice or speech patterns for the role. I can’t see a Pikachu. I can only see a TV-Y Deadpool in a yellow fleece. When you get well-known for a particular performance type (like Nicholas Cage, Jeff Goldblum, or recent Johnny Depp) it makes it really hard to distinguish your characters apart from each other when they all act the exact same way. Just…distracting.

summary: I’m starting to think that the war against cringe culture will have to rely on how Detective Pikachu and Sonic the Hedgehog fare...
body:
I’m starting to think that the war against cringe culture will have to rely on how Detective Pikachu and Sonic the Hedgehog fare with critics, fans, and the box office next year.

Especially Sonic. Oh boy…

summary: hey guys im like totally cool with you know making live action movies of traditionally cartoonish animated things like pokemon...
body:
hey guys im like totally cool with you know making live action movies of traditionally cartoonish animated things like pokemon and sonic and all but could we just uh. all get on board with roger rabbit rules?

like okay if you have an AMAZING way to translate this cartoonish character to a more realistic style, go for it. detective pikachu is kinda hit and miss here, some of the designs are great and other ones i wish they would have commited more to the either realistic or the cartoony side, plus i wish there was less emphasis on the realistic=add textures to cartoon without changing porportions idea, but you know what they did fine mostly. and while the sonic silhouette is for right now full of mostly horrifying possibility maybe it will turn out fine!! butimnotholdingmybreath

but i dont think im the only one who would be perfectly fine with completely unrealistic, obviously animated characters. does it break the “immersion”? yeah, a little, especially if its done badly. but when its done well, a la roger rabbit, it doesnt really matter if youre not completely immersed because it just looks good. if you have actually good realistic designs, use them!! but if its a choice between this weird uncanny valley thing where you just slap a million hair follicles and some detailed ass eyes on the usual model, vs a really cute but obviously animated game style character, i want the latter. please give me the latter. i promise you, i wont walk out of the theatre because i cant see every pore on sonics muzzle.
